intro: Entadopsis nana, commonly known as the dwarf entadopsis, is a small herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 30 centimeters, featuring simple, alternate leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying shades of pink or white, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its compact size and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
